title: Co-Applicant verification - Apply for probate
introduction: {applicantName} has started an application for a grant of probate to deal with {deceasedName}’s estate, and has named you as an applicant.
paragraph1: All applicants named on the grant will be given the legal right to:
listItem1: collect the estate’s assets (property, money and possessions)
listItem3: distribute what is left to the people entitled to it
paragraph2: To continue, you will need to:
listItem4: check if the information {applicantName} has given is correct
listItem5: confirm you agree with the legal statement
paragraph3: You will need {deceasedName}’s date of death to access the legal statement.
multipleHeader: If you do not want to apply for probate
paragraph4: You can choose not to apply if you do not want to manage the estate. This does not affect your right to inherit.
listItem7: appoint someone else to apply on your behalf – you will need to complete Form PA12 (opens in a new tab)
paragraph6: You will need to contact {applicantName} and ask them to change the information they have given if you do not want to apply.
